clinical_study.brief_title: 18 Month Prospective Efficacy and Safety Study of Bimatoprost Intracameral Implant (DURYSTA)
clinical_study.official_title: ARGOS - A Phase IV, Prospective, 18-month Study to Assess the Effectiveness and Safety of Bimatoprost Intracameral Implant (DURYSTA) in US Clinical Practice

brief_summary.textblock: Study to collect effectiveness and safety data after administration of a bimatoprost intracameral implant in patients with open-angle glaucoma (OAG) or ocular hypertension (OHT).

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes that did not receive additional Intraocular Pressure (IOP) -lowering intervention/therapy per standard medical care
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes not receiving additional IOP-lowering intervention/therapy per standard medical care
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes not receiving additional IOP-lowering intervention/therapy per standard medical care
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from bimatoprost intracameral implant to first additional IOP-lowering intervention/therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first IOP-lowering intervention is defined as the time between treatment and IOP-lowering intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving the predefined IOP outcomes without receiving additional IOP-lowering intervention/therapy
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the study eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean reduction in the number of topical IOP-lowering medications
secondary_outcome.description: A numerical count by class of drug of topical IOP lowering medications being taken.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving complete success
secondary_outcome.description: Complete success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg without any additional IOP lowering interventions/therapies after administration of the bimatoprost intracameral implant.

secondary_outcome.description: Complete success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg without any additional IOP lowering interventions/therapies after administration of the bimatoprost intracameral implant.

secondary_outcome.description: Complete success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg without any additional IOP lowering interventions/therapies after administration of the bimatoprost intracameral implant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving complete success
secondary_outcome.description: Complete success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg without any additional IOP lowering interventions/therapies after administration of the bimatoprost intracameral implant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving qualified success
secondary_outcome.description: Partial success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg with no Secondary Surgical Intervention (SSI) for glaucoma, while staying on the same or fewer topical IOP-lowering medications than baseline and or Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty (SLT), Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty (ALT) or MicroPulse Laser Trabeculoplasty (MLT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving qualified success
secondary_outcome.description: Partial success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg with no Secondary Surgical Intervention (SSI) for glaucoma, while staying on the same or fewer topical IOP-lowering medications than baseline and or Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty (SLT), Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty (ALT) or MicroPulse Laser Trabeculoplasty (MLT).

secondary_outcome.description: Partial success is defined as treated eyes with IOP <=18 mm Hg with no Secondary Surgical Intervention (SSI) for glaucoma, while staying on the same or fewer topical IOP-lowering medications than baseline and or Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty (SLT), Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty (ALT) or MicroPulse Laser Trabeculoplasty (MLT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated eyes achieving qualified success
secondary_outcome.description: Partial success is defined as treated eyes with IOP ≤18 mm Hg with no Secondary Surgical Intervention (SSI) for glaucoma, while staying on the same or fewer topical IOP-lowering medications than baseline and or Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty (SLT), Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty (ALT) or MicroPulse Laser Trabeculoplasty (MLT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing treatment emergent adverse events

arm_group.description: Patients with OAG or OHT who are scheduled for intracameral administration of a bimatoprost intracameral implant by their ophthalmologist.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include US patients with OAG or OHT who are scheduled for administration of a bimatoprost intracameral implant by their ophthalmologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient diagnosed with OAG or OHT who is scheduled to receive a bimatoprost intracameral implant in at least one eye.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of any of the following ocular surgeries in the eye due to receive a bimatoprost intracameral implant:Ahmed Glaucoma Valve, Baerveldt shunt, Ex-Press glaucoma shunt implantation, Molteno shunt, Trabeculectomy, Vitrectomy, retinal surgery, CyPass Micro-Stent or Anterior Chamber Intraocular Lens (AC IOL) placement.
- Concurrent or anticipated enrollment in an interventional clinical trial involving either an investigational medicinal product or medical device.
- Previous enrollment in another Allergan bimatoprost intracameral implant study.
